verses.roman:
ānande raghunāthera bāhya vismaraṇa
kāya-mane sevilena gaurāṅga-caraṇa

synonyms: ānande—in transcendental bliss; raghunāthera—of Raghunātha dāsa; bāhya vismaraṇa—forgetting everything external; kāya-mane—by mind and body; sevilena—served; gaurāṅga-caraṇa—the lotus feet of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu.
translation: Raghunātha dāsa's transcendental bliss was boundless. Forgetting everything external, he served the lotus feet of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu with his body and mind.
